name: Hawaiian Trinity
description: Hawaiian Trinity by Pua Mana 1st Hawaiian Pakalolo Seed Bank is a sativa-dominant hybrid created by crossing the legendary Kona Gold and Trinity. It has a unique terpene profile that smells like burnt rubber tires, tropically flavored taffy, and a hint of unnamable funkiness. This odd aroma gives way to tropical and earthy flavors that linger on the tongue well after exhale. Hawaiian Trinity sprouts large frosty colas and tends to offer consumers an intense physical rush that mellows out into a deeply sedating body high.

This odd aroma gives way to tropical and earthy flavors that linger on the tongue well after exhale. highlightedReviews.text:
Hawaiian Pakalōlō is world renown for so many reasons it would take plenty seasons to describe every vibe. 


Hawai'i has very high humidity - as well as the high HI temperatures we know and love causing Hawaiian strains to develop an incredible resistance to mold along with massive yields!


This combination is vital for patients wishing to avoid losses to mold and get massive amounts of medicine every harvest.


Enter Hawaiian Trinity:


Trinity is Afghan76 x Master Kush cultivated in the Pacific Northwest by master growers upon a quest to bring the thunder to the community - their quest was a success and another legendary strain began her journey on planet Pakalōlō.


Pua Mana 1st Hawaiian Pakalōlō Seed Bank chose Trinity to breed with Hawaiian as many growers from Hawai'i and the Pacific Northwest requested a faster flowering HI hybrid combining the essences of 2 favorite flavors from Big I to the Pacific Northwest:


Mission accomplished!! 


Mahalo Ke Akua = Thank God!!!


 

Yield: Nui = Big, Large 

Flavor: Hashy, Laffy Taffy, Rubber Tire funk    

Flower time: 9-10 weeks

Photoperiod: Traditional 12/12 

Indoor/Outdoor: Can/Can 


#HawaiianTrinity
Another great strain to grow outdoors (big  up Puamana Ohana!).  Sweet yet pungent smell with soda can size kolas.  My harvest is still drying and I am overly anxious to smoke it.
